item.title: Possible El Niño within months raising potential for hot, dry year across Australia
item.description: The first El Niño in three years could develop during the coming months, raising the possibility of worsening drought and extreme heat across Australia in 2026.

item.title: Animal abuse charge takes one year as RSPCA prosecutions in Queensland drastically decline
item.description: A man has been charged with animal cruelty a year after neighbours first made a complaint to the RSPCA.

item.title: Baker Boy talks new album Djandjay, Riverboats festival and family legacy
item.description: The Yolŋu artist known as the Fresh Prince of Arnhem Land is the king of feel-good bilingual bangers. But heavy is the crown.

item.title: James Van Der Beek, star of Dawson's Creek, dies aged 48 after colorectal cancer diagnosis
item.description: The American actor was best known for his starring role as Dawson Leery in Dawson's Creek from 1998 to 2003.

item.title: Liberal frontbench resignations snowball as Ley backer resigns — as it happened
item.description: Angus Taylor has confirmed he will challenge Opposition Leader Sussan Ley for the leadership at the meeting.

item.title: Pam Bondi grilled over Epstein files as survivors express fury over redactions
item.description: US Attorney-General Pam Bondi faces furious questions over the censorship of names in the Epstein files at a heated hearing before a committee of Congress.

item.title: Australians feel divided as Albanese asks to 'turn the temperature down'
item.description: Most Australians want greater social cohesion here, even if they don't see much of it right now.

item.title: Darwin traditional owners feel 'bulldozed' by ambitious solar farm company's approach to consultation
item.description: A renewable energy company planning to build a solar farm near Darwin is seeking a court ruling that no native title claim exists at the proposed site.

item.title: Carers WA struggling to cope with unprecedented demand for support services
item.description: An organisation that helps people caring for vulnerable family members in WA is experiencing unprecedented demand, with services unable to keep up with the community's needs.

item.title: Future of Port Hedland's West End uncertain after buyback scheme ends
item.description: As Port Hedland's controversial dust buyback scheme winds up, Pilbara Ports quietly walks away from major plans to build a training facility and accommodation, with development plans for the area still uncertain.

item.title: Authorities warn Alice Springs flash flooding threat isn't over, more Central Australian rain predicted
item.description: Authorities are warning Alice Springs could face further flooding overnight, with forecasts of more wet weather posing a threat to slowly receding water levels.

item.title: Dispute over West Bank football pitch sparks international campaign
item.description: A campaign to save a West Bank football pitch from demolition has gone global. The sport's most powerful bodies, as well as social media influencers, have intervened to pressure Israeli authorities to reconsider its destruction.

item.title: South Africa beats Afghanistan at Twenty20 World Cup after two super overs at Narendra Modi Stadium
item.description: South Africa wins the most dramatic T20 World Cup group stage clash with Afghanistan, featuring two super overs and countless twists of fortune.

item.title: FBI combs desert terrain for clues in Nancy Guthrie's disappearance
item.description: The man detained for questioning in the investigation into the disappearance of a US TV show host's mother has been released and the search continues.

item.title: Declining birth rates in southern right whales alarm researchers in new study
item.description: New research on the birth rates of southern right whales – once touted as a global conservation success story – has revealed an alarming decline.

item.title: Mackay MP who crossed floor to oppose LNP ban on abortion debate defends actions
item.description: Mackay MP Nigel Dalton crossed the floor on Tuesday to vote with Katter's Australian Party to end a parliamentary ban on abortion debate.

item.title: Albemarle's lithium refinery in WA's South West placed on care and maintenance
item.description: A multi-billion-dollar lithium refinery in WA's South West has been shut down, affecting about 275 workers.

item.title: Scotty James and Valentino Guseli raise their level at 'unbelievable' snowboard halfpipe qualifier at Winter Olympic Games
item.description: Scotty James is the man to beat in the snowboard halfpipe at the 2026 Winter Olympics, but a stunning qualifying competition proves that the final is going to be on another level entirely.

item.title: UK police to decide on Andrew Mounbatten-Windsor Epstein trade document investigation
item.description: British police say they are "making progress as quickly as possible" on whether to launch a full investigation into allegations that Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor shared confidential trade documents with late financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Plotters, kingmakers and dark horses — the Liberals vying for control
item.description: Parliament House has entered the spill zone, where politics is at its most primal. Here are the Liberals jostling for control of their much-reduced party.

item.title: Tasmanian man Corey Chugg found alive four days after going missing in bushland
item.description: The 32-year-old man went into a bushland with a friend to collect firewood on Sunday. Police say he has been found alive at the bottom of a steep incline.

item.title: Labor releases audio of Liberal MP backtracking on $495 million cost of living policy at industry event
item.description: South Australia's Treasurer says the Liberal Party has secretly dumped its major $495 million policy less than six weeks out from the state election, with the Opposition arguing it has to wind back Labor's tax due to state budget blowouts.

item.title: Camels dying from dehydration descend on APY Lands
item.description: Large mobs of camels wreak havoc in remote Indigenous communities as they desperately search for water.

item.title: James Van Der Beek was synonymous with his character. How he embraced it with humour will be his legacy
item.description: James Van Der Beek's death prompts wide-ranging tributes from co-stars and friends who have praised his kindness and humour.

item.title: RBA governor accused by senator of 'gaslighting' Australians on economy
item.description: Reserve Bank governor Michele Bullock fires back at Nationals senator Matt Canavan after he accused her of "gaslighting" Australians over the state of the Australian economy.

item.title: Support firms for Angus Taylor to win Liberal leadership, though Ley expected to achieve 'good result'
item.description: Support is firming for Angus Taylor to topple Opposition Leader Sussan Ley, though her supporters still expect her to achieve a "good result".

item.title: Mother of autistic man starved to death in Gold Coast hospital 'satisfied' with damning investigation
item.description: Queensland’s health watchdog finds Stewart Kelly's 2022 hospital death was the result of systemic failures in care, particularly around responding to his complex needs.

item.title: Chocolate recipes to share some love with the people in your life
item.description: Whether you are into Valentine's Day or not, these chocolate recipes are perfect for sharing some love.

item.description: The Liberals have spent the week embroiled in leadership woes as the party braces for a spill on Friday morning.

item.title: Gas exploration seismic testing project rejected in south-west Victoria
item.description: A controversial seismic testing proposal off Victoria's south-west coast has been rejected in a "rare" move from the offshore regulator.

item.description: The mother of a young boy killed in a house fire in 2017 has given emotional evidence at an inquest into his death.

item.title: New video shows violent arrest of Australian filmmaker James Ricketson at Sydney's anti-Herzog protest
item.description: New video obtained by ABC NEWS Verify shows in vivid detail the arrest of a 76-year-old man, who was later released without charge.

item.title: Barbeques Galore enters receivership as debt burns into bottom line
item.description: Barbeques Galore has plunged into receivership, leaving question marks for nearly 100 stores that employ about 500 staff.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit to implement recommendations for workplace culture overhaul
item.description: Staff at the Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit will be implementing recommended changes to their workplace culture following an independent review.

item.title: Teen bounces back from nasty crash to snatch gold from American great
item.description: Two-time Winter Olympic champion Chloe Kim is pipped for first place by 17-year-old Gaon Choi late in the women's snowboard halfpipe final at the Milano Cortina Games.

item.title: Children prescribed puberty blockers without proper assessment at Cairns health service, review finds
item.description: The review of the Cairns paediatric gender health service found that children as young as 12 were given puberty blockers inconsistently and without formal consent.

item.title: Father finds family's bones in rubble of Gaza house destroyed in air strikes
item.description: Mahmoud Hammad believes he has found his family's remains in the rubble of his house, which was destroyed more than two years ago in air strikes, killing his pregnant wife and their five children.

item.title: Nightcliff by-election set for March 7, Greens and Labor announce candidates
item.description: The Greens and Labor have announced their candidates for the Nightcliff by-election, set for March 7, after the resignation of Greens MLA Kat McNamara earlier this week.

item.title: Israeli president faces protests in Melbourne
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: IOC disqualifies Ukrainian skeleton racer Vladyslav Heraskevych over helmet
item.description: Vladyslav Heraskevych is disqualified over his customised helmet featuring the faces of Ukrainian athletes and coaches killed in the Russia-Ukraine war.

item.title: Muslim men had permission to pray before officers removed them from Sydney protest, police say
item.description: A group of Muslim men had already received police permission to worship during a Sydney protest before they were disrupted mid-prayer by officers, NSW Police Force confirms.

item.title: Cooper Woods wins Australia's first gold of 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics
item.description: Cooper Woods has stunned the moguls field to win a maiden career title at the 2026 Winter Olympic Games at Milano Cortina.

item.title: Cooper Woods welcomed to the Winter Olympic 'gold medal club' by Alisa Camplin-Warner
item.description: Only seven Australian athletes have ever felt the weight of a Winter Olympic gold medal being hung around their necks. And one of the first, Alisa Camplin-Warner, was thrilled to welcome the most recent, Cooper Woods, to the club.

item.title: Liberal Party poised to dump first female federal leader
item.description: The Liberal Party is poised to dump its first federal female leader, with Sussan Ley's supporters acknowledging her rival, Angus Taylor, is in the "ascendancy".

item.title: 3,100 aged care patients stranded in hospitals as states again press Commonwealth for action
item.description: With the ink still wet on a new hospital deal, state and territory health ministers will today use a meeting with their federal counterpart to call for urgent action on stranded patients.

item.title: Water utility 'confident' Hobart drinking water is antibiotic-free after salmon disease outbreak
item.description: Tasmania's water provider says there is no risk of antibiotics entering Hobart's water supply, following Huon Aquaculture's use of oxytetracycline in the River Derwent to treat a disease outbreak.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: A leadership spill, a ghost barge and mysterious balls
item.description: Have you been paying attention to the headlines this week? Test yourself here.

item.title: Italy wins first T20 Cricket World Cup match as Australian-born players shine in 10-wicket win over Nepal
item.description: Sydney-born brothers Justin and Anthony Mosca have guided T20 World Cup debutants Italy to their first win in the tournament, as their unbeaten half-centuries secured a dominant 10-wicket victory over Nepal on Thursday.

item.title: Cooper Woods, Australia's unexpected Winter Olympic champion, finds his purpose
item.description: Cooper Woods came into the 2026 Winter Olympic Games ranked 22nd in the World Cup rankings in moguls. But in finding his purpose, he roared to a glorious gold medal.

item.description: After months of speculation, Liberals hope Angus Taylor can bring the Liberals back from what many in the party fear is the edge of obscurity.

item.description: The economics professor is the second academic economist added to the board since a review recommended boosting its expertise.

item.description: More than 100 Stolen Generations survivors have gathered in Canberra for the apology anniversary. The government is pledging new money to help them heal.

item.description: A centuries-old nautical technique is being redesigned within a small Sydney cove in a bid to save a tiny remnant population of a dying species.

item.description: South-east Queensland is being told to brace for an intense soaking from today with up to 150 millimetres to fall in some coastal areas and rainfall all weekend.

item.description: Farmers and agricultural workers are taking to social media to educate a new audience while building a community.

item.description: Consumer advocates and the wood products industry say it is time the origin of timber was made clear, as imports grow year-on-year.

item.description: New research shows some of the coolabahs and river red gums in the Gwydir Wetlands, New South Wales are hundreds of years old, and hold important climate history.

item.description: Finding time to volunteer can be a stretch for most people, but for Darwin doctor Felix Ho, who volunteers thousands of hours every year, it's his "full-time hobby".

item.description: Market analysts have blamed a share market sell-off on an increasing trend that is resulting in heavy stock selling as investors fear a meltdown on Wall Street's last day of trade for the week. Look back on the day's business developments in our blog.

item.description: After experiencing the Bondi terror attack in December, this composer's new music grew to encompass love's power to heal us from hate and harm.

item.description: Experts say you don't need to pull out the entire contents of a cupboard, beginning with one bag is best.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Breezy Johnson gets engaged at the Games, Snoop Dogg shows plenty of support — quick hits from day six
item.description: Breezy Johnson's pain of crashing was washed away by the euphoria of love, while Snoop Dogg showed his support with a magnificent snow jacket. Here are the quick hits from the Winter Olympics.

item.description: Cooper Woods's moguls gold puts Australia ahead of powerhouses Canada and China on the official Winter Olympics medal tally, despite having fewer medals overall.

item.title: Albany Woollen Mills' 101 years celebrated via shared love of blankets
item.description: Established in 1925, Western Australia's first and only woollen mill transformed raw wool into fabric and blankets, becoming a cornerstone of Albany's industry before closing in 2002.

item.description: Cam Bolton's broken neck hangs heavily over the Australian snowboard cross team, with his late replacement Jimmy Johnstone vowing his appearance was "all for him".

item.description: A Queensland coroner finds the cause of Indigenous man Steven Nixon-McKellar's death during an arrest was "multi-factorial".

item.description: Self-belief is the most powerful tool at an athlete's disposal, and Josie Baff utilised it to its fullest extent with a magical run to gold in the 2026 Winter Olympics snowboard cross.

item.description: Scotty James has fallen short of an elusive Olympic gold, instead claiming a second silver medal in the snowboard halfpipe.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Chickens help autistic teen Summer Farrelly make sense of humans
item.description: While growing up, people didn't make much sense to Summer, but chickens always did. Now, Summer is using what they learnt to help other children with autism understand human interactions.

item.title: How Indonesians are fighting plummeting marriage rates
item.description: Marriage is still a life goal in Indonesia, but the number of marriages has plummeted over the past decade.

item.title: Ad for decimal currency 1966
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Remember Dollar Bill? It's been 60 years since Australia made the big change to decimal currency
item.description: Six decades ago, Australia swapped its old currency for dollars and cents. A catchy jingle sung by a cartoon character named Dollar Bill helped the country adapt.

item.title: Parents fail to return consent forms as Far North Queensland HPV vaccination rate drops
item.description: Cairns Public Health Unit says students are increasingly missing their school HPV vaccinations because they do not have parental consent.

item.title: Ready-to-go breakfast sandwiches that will get you through the day - ABC News
item.description: Want a prepped breakfast with plenty of protein? These omelette sandwiches keep for three days in the fridge, ready to pop in a sandwich press in the morning.

item.title: Easy, tasty and nutritious recipes for sharing this Ramadan
item.description: Looking for easy, nutritious Ramadan recipes? These options will help you prepare for and break your fast well.

item.title: Solo diver recounts brush with mako sharks off Tasmanian coast
item.description: Phillip Ellis Wells was solo diving roughly 7 kilometres off the east coast of Tasmania when he noticed a shadow pass overhead.

item.title: Innovative cattle loading ramp puts animal welfare at centre of design
item.description: A retired truck driver has developed a wide, steel, cattle-loading ramp that allows animals to walk side by side, mimicking natural herd behaviour and reducing noise, agitation and the risk of injury during transport.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Injured Australians return home from Games, skating union defends controversial scoring — quick hits from day seven
item.description: A petition to investigate the judging of the ice dance competition has been dismissed by the sport's governing body, as two injured Australians are forced home from the Games. Here are the quick hits from the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Scotty James left numb by the tragedy of 'almost' at 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games
item.description: Scotty James has sought what resides at the end of the Olympic rainbow his whole career. But for the third time, he's had to settle for the numbing pain of almost being an Olympic champion.

item.title: Brisbane escapes heavy rainfall but a wet weekend ahead, bureau says
item.description: Predicted downpours bypassed Brisbane but regions south and north of the city have seen big rainfall totals

item.title: Jane Hume was punished for her election slips. Now she's been crowned deputy Liberal leader
item.description: The Victorian senator was unceremoniously turfed from Sussan Ley's ministry after being tarred personally with much of what went wrong in the Coalition's cataclysmic loss. On Friday, she ascended to the Liberal's second-in-command.

item.title: Heat of summers gone by still fresh in the memory of 98yo Clarence 'Clack' John
item.description: Clarence "Clack" John has been through 98 summers in Renmark, South Australia. But as the town sweltered through its hottest recorded day last month, he remembers hot weather before records began.

item.title: Oscar Piastri raises safety concerns ahead of F1 Australian Grand Prix
item.description: Oscar Piastri has raised concerns about safety issues at the upcoming Australian Grand Prix, worried about potential chaos at the very start of the F1 season opener.

item.title: ECU opens in Perth CBD, with WA Academy of Performing Arts as its centrepiece
item.description: Thousands of students will inject vibrancy and life into Perth's CBD with the opening of the new Edith Cowan University. But how will the city cope with influx of people?

item.title: Police appeal for help after 'priceless' Egyptian artefacts stolen from Caboolture museum north of Brisbane
item.description: An ancient burial mask, cat figurine and jewellery are among the "priceless" Egyptian artefacts stolen from the Abbey Museum of Art and Archaeology yesterday.

item.title: Australia and EU set to ink landmark free trade agreement
item.description: Australia and the European Union are on the cusp of finally reaching a free trade agreement after years of sometimes fraught negotiations.

item.title: Broome man had to wait for someone to die to access dialysis in his hometown
item.description: Kimberley resident David Lawford had to wait in Perth until someone in his hometown died before he could get access to dialysis on his return.

item.title: John F Kennedy Jr and Carolyn Bessette met a tragic end, but America's fascination endures
item.description: The public's obsession with one of America's most storied political dynasties has been fuelled by tragedies, such as the doomed romance between John F Kennedy Jr and Carolyn Bessette.

item.title: Roads, homes, cars damaged as Alice Springs starts flash flood clean-up
item.description: With Alice Springs homes, businesses and roads damaged by flash flooding this week, the government is facing pressure to improve local flood mitigation measures.

item.title: Former AFL captain Dyson Heppell speaks about unhealthy relationship with food during playing career
item.description: Former Essendon captain Dyson Heppell has spoken about the unhealthy relationship he had with food early in his career.

item.title: Pair who plotted Islamic State-inspired attack on Jews in UK jailed for life
item.description: A UK court jails two men for life for planning an Islamic State-inspired gun attack on a Jewish gathering in northern England.

item.title: Cam Bolton sent message of support to Josie Baff before she won gold at the 2026 Winter Olympic Games
item.description: The injury-ravaged Australian snowboard cross team earned an enormous boost with Josie Baff's Winter Olympic gold medal, with injured teammate Cam Bolton urging his teammate to keep the faith.

item.title: Valentino Guseli thought he saw an 'omen from the shred gods' during the 2026 Winter Olympics halfpipe final
item.description: As Valentino Guseli watched his teammate Scotty James "tearing" the halfpipe apart, he thought an "omen from the shred gods" would deliver him an elusive Olympic gold medal.

item.title: WA Coroner finds 'cascade of events' responsible for heart attack death of man arrested at Perth Underground Station
item.description: A coronial inquest into the death of a 24-year-old man at a Perth train station finds the act of restraining him in a face-down position likely contributed to his death.

item.title: Ningaloo campsite booking system, which crashed moments after going live, to be reviewed
item.description: A West Australian department is working to refine its new campsite booking system for a World Heritage area after its website crashed during the first week of the trial.

item.title: Wool price jumps ahead of industry-first Chinese New Year break
item.description: As wool growers enjoy their best prices since 2019, the market will now pause to respect China's request for a week off to celebrate Lunar New Year.

item.title: Chris Baghsarian, 85, kidnapped in reported case of mistaken identity in Sydney
item.description: Police make a rare appeal in what they say is the mistaken identity kidnapping of 85-year-old Chris Baghsarian in Sydney.

item.title: New Liberal leader Angus Taylor says he wants to focus on housing affordability
item.description: New Liberal Party leader Angus Taylor says restoring voter confidence in the Liberal party will be challenging.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 8
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Major construction starts on Adelaide's first skyscraper Festival Tower Two
item.description: Festival Tower Two is set to tower over South Australia's Parliament House, which the premier says will bring money and people into the city, but others remain against the $800 million project.

item.title: Two women die in crash after police pursuit in Sydney's south-west as critical incident declared
item.description: NSW Police say they pursued a red sedan after it had been stolen from a petrol station in South Hurstville and its owner allegedly assaulted.

item.title: The US government has just entered another shutdown. Here's what it means this time
item.description: After Congress failed to pass laws necessary to fully fund the US government, one of its biggest departments has shut down.

item.title: Hundreds hit New South Wales beach for Valentine's Day Pride Paddle out
item.description: Disability groups, nippers and members of the LGBTQIA+ community are among thousands celebrating love and inclusion on Aussie beaches.

item.title: US police set up roadblock in Arizona in search for Nancy Guthrie
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Thousands march in support of global day of action for regime change in Iran
item.description: Organisers billed the protest as part of a "global day of action in solidarity with Iran's Lion and Sun revolution".

item.title: Carlton star taken to hospital as Victoria holds off WA in AFL Origin
item.description: Victoria holds off a spirited WA side to win the first Aussie rules State of Origin clash for 27 years, though the game is marred by a serious injury to Carlton star Jacob Weitering.

item.title: Live: Australia's greatest Winter Olympian makes 2026 the country's best Games
item.description: Jakara Anthony's dual moguls gold makes her Australia's first double Winter Olympic champion and adds a third win to the team's tally to make Milano Cortina the country's greatest Winter Games. Follow live.

item.title: Laura Peel's Olympic journey ends before even stepping onto snow at 2026 Milano Cortina Games
item.description: Instead of the glint of gold, Laura Peel's lasting Olympic memory will be the glittering diamonds of despair in Zhangjiakou, with the 36-year-old ruled out of the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milano Cortina after suffering a knee injury on the eve of the Games.

item.title: Jakara Anthony wins dual moguls gold at 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics
item.description: Jakara Anthony achieves Winter Olympic redemption, claiming a stunning gold medal in the women's dual moguls.

item.title: Russia poisoned opposition leader Alexei Navalny, UK and allies say
item.description: Five European foreign ministers say analysis of samples from the former Russian opposition leader, who died two years ago, confirmed the presence of a toxin from poison frogs.

item.title: Australians' right to protest may be more fragile than you think
item.description: From 418 arrests in 1977 to fresh clashes in Sydney: The fragility of Australians' right to protest and what makes a reasonable police response is under scrutiny

item.title: Taylor faces formidable task rebuilding Liberals' electoral fortunes
item.description: The paralysing uncertainty that weighed on the Liberals' faces has lifted for now, but morale in politics follows results rather than reshuffles.

item.title: Hard Quiz: Think you know the answers? That confidence won't last long
item.description: I admire your courage for giving the quiz another go. Just kidding, I never feel that way.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Jakara Anthony responds to adversity and delivers a golden reply she sorely deserved
item.description: Jakara Anthony stared down adversity, swallowed back her pain, and delivered a performance for the ages to become Australia's greatest Winter Olympian.

item.title: What we know (and don't) about One Nation's rapid rise in the polls
item.description: Pauline Hanson's One Nation has seen the fastest polling rise in modern Australian politics. What is going on?

item.title: The opening of Aud Mason-Hyde's talk at TEDx Adelaide
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Sophie Hyde’s dad came out when she was a baby. It shaped three generations.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Director Sophie Hyde unpacks long-held family secrets in her latest film Jimpa
item.description: Sophie Hyde's films have won awards at Sundance and Berlin, but she has more riding on her latest release. She's turned the lens on the long-held secrets of her unconventional family.

item.title: Palestinians say Israel's new plans for the West Bank kill statehood hopes
item.description: As Israel's security cabinet agreed on a plan that would pave the way for future settlements in the occupied West Bank, Palestinians say the pressure from Israeli settlers is relentless.

item.title: Rise of Australia's public economy is comparable to the mining boom of the 2000s, analyst says
item.description: Long-term structural shifts have gravitational forces that are hard to escape, says a Westpac economist.

item.title: A drunk purchase, a battling Macclesfield club, and a Crystal Palace football upset for the ages
item.description: Rob Smethurst was in the throes of a four-day drunken bender when a friend called and told him his local football team was for sale. Now his tiny English club is making global headlines.

item.title: Winter Olympics legend Eugenio Monti, the Italian sledder who helped his rivals win gold
item.description: As Bree Walker aims to create Olympic history in the women's monobob, she will do so on a track named after a man who made history of his own through one of the Winter Games' most selfless acts.

item.title: These mums raise other people's children to secure a future for their own
item.description: A generation of children in South-East Asia are growing up without their mothers, who have to work abroad for decades to make ends meet.

item.title: Alex de Minaur through to ATP Rotterdam Open final with win over Ugo Humbert
item.description: Alex de Minaur becomes the first man to reach three consecutive finals at the Rotterdam Open.

item.title: Researchers warn climate-linked disease leptospirosis spreading south
item.description: Researchers say leptospirosis is emerging as a climate‑driven health threat in Australia, with frequent storms, floods and heatwaves pushing the disease further south.

item.title: ACT Brumbies defeat Western Force 56-24 in Super Rugby Pacific
item.description: The ACT Brumbies have turned up the heat to blitz the Western Force 56-24 in a sapping season-opening Super Rugby Pacific clash in Perth.

item.title: Dry January hits southern Australia as east coast lows drop off the radar
item.description: Rainfall was below average for most of Australia's south-east, far-west and central regions in the first month of the year.

item.title: How a pocket of Sydney's inner west went from Australia's deepest coal mine to waterfront houses
item.description: What was once a working class, coal-fuelled borough is now a sought-after suburb in Sydney's inner west, with houses selling for millions.

item.title: Sharing emergency resources becoming more complicated as fire and flood seasons overlap
item.description: With fires and floods occurring simultaneously, and overlapping with international deployments, sharing critical resources is becoming an increasingly complex task.

item.title: Wheelchair user Michael Lord an 'invaluable' surf lifesaver at Port Macquarie's Flynns Beach
item.description: A decade on from a devastating diagnosis, Michael Lord finds purpose through volunteering with his local surf lifesaving club.

item.title: Police block road near Nancy Guthrie's home during investigation into her disappearance
item.description: Authorities investigating the disappearance of American morning show host Savannah Guthrie's mother seal off a road near Nancy Guthrie's Arizona home.
